page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: Aspatria is surrounded by farms which are predominantly cultivated grassland used for pasture,hay and silage to feed both dairy and beef cattle and sheep. Other crops include barley,potatoes,turnips and chinese cabbage. These last two are used as winter fodder. The dairy cattle are usually Fresian and their milk is collected once a day by a milk tanker from the farm and taken to the Dairy in Aspatria to be made into cheese. The beef cattle are mainly Charolais, Limousin and Herefords and are sold at auctions at Wigton, Carlisle and Cockermouth. The sheep are mainly Scottish Blackface, Leicester and Suffolks. To supply the farms there are three specialist suppliers in Aspatria. These are Hillary's,who supply tractor
